timeline.message:
Checkout from android_x_migration
Merged major_release_4.0.0 into this new branch and resolve conflicts
Now will merge this into android_x_migration and force push

Android X migration for demo app
* Updated all dependencies to Android x minimums with ranges
  * androidx.cardview:cardview:[1.0.0, 1.99.99]
  * androidx.appcompat:appcompat:[1.0.0, 1.99.99]
  * androidx.legacy:legacy-support-v4:[1.0.0, 1.99.99]
  * androidx.vectordrawable:vectordrawable:[1.0.0, 1.99.99]
* Updated demo app XML
  * Android X scroll behavior
  * All Right and Left based attributes now ave the matching Start and End attributes to match and remove errors/warnings
* Demo app build.gradle updates
  * Android SDK min for demo app is 16
  * Added compile options to demo app build.gradle

Android X migration for onesignal SDK
* Android X libs replace all Android support libs
* Set mUnsubscribeWhenNotificationsAreDisabled to true
* Set mDisplayOption to NOTIFICATION
* Updated OneSignalChromeTab class to work with Android X
* Updated all GCM to FCM across codebase
* Deleted PREFS_OS_FILTER_OTHER_GCM_RECEIVERS param
* Updated dependencies to Android X min
  * com.google.android.gms:play-services-location:[17.0.0, 17.99.99]
  * com.google.android.gms:play-services-ads-identifier:[17.0.0, 17.99.99]
  * com.google.android.gms:play-services-base:[17.0.0, 17.99.99]
  * com.google.firebase:firebase-messaging:[19.0.0, 20.99.99]
* Updated gradle for onesignal
  * Min SDK is 16 now
  * Gradle wrapper 5.6.4
  * Build Gradle 3.6.2

Android X migration for unit tests
* Updated all android support to Android X libs
* Updated all GCM to FCM across unit tests
* Updated min sdk to 16
* Updated dependencies to min Android X
  * com.google.android.gms:play-services-location:17.0.0
  * com.google.firebase:firebase-core:17.2.2
Changed androidx.appcompat to api and added a range of versions

Was not receiving notifications on device
* Fixed this by using
  * com.google.android.c2dm.intent.RECEIVE in FCMBroadcastReceiver and AndroidManifest action name
  * Should eventually be com.google.firebase.MESSAGING_EVENT but wa snot able ot ge this working correctly

Was not receiving notifications on device
* Fixed this by using
  * com.google.android.c2dm.intent.RECEIVE in FCMBroadcastReceiver and AndroidManifest action name
  * Should eventually be com.google.firebase.MESSAGING_EVENT but wa snot able ot ge this working correctly

Unit Tests FCM intent action issue
* Fixed this by using
  * com.google.android.c2dm.intent.RECEIVE instead of com.google.firebase.MESSAGING_EVENT
  * Should eventually be com.google.firebase.MESSAGING_EVENT but was not able ot ge this working correctly

timeline.bodyText: This needs to say "gcm". This it the payload that the "Google Play services" app sends and it outside of the control of that app.
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText: The original checked was processedResult.isOneSignalPayload && OneSignal.getFilterOtherGCMReceivers(context) so this means we should now remove rocessedResult.isOneSignalPayload.
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText: yes, this FCMBroadcastReceiver class is really independent of FCM or GCM. Since this class directly handles the Intent fired from the "Google Play services" app. This receiver would still work if you completely removed both the FCM and GCM libraries from the app. (Today OneSignal uses the FCM / GCM library to register for a push token)
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText: setAbort(); should be removed completely now that OneSignal.getFilterOtherGCMReceivers(context) is gone.
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText: Remove this comment, per the logic change noted in the comment just below.
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText: This was not done in this PR. Keep this comment. Also FCM migration is out of scope of an AndroidX migration so I would recommend a different PR.
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText: Put back to "gcm", see my comment in FCMBroadcastReceiver
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.message:
Reverted some partially FCM migrations
* Now only naming has been changed to prepare for FCM migration
  * Still using GCM, but FCM names everywhere until FIREBASE_MESSAGING action is added
  * Changed back to "gcm" type for payload expectation

UnitTest no longer relevant because GCM filtering is removed
* Refactored in previous commit(s) on accident to FCM but should have been GCM and the deleted
